intro: Hieracium praepallens, commonly known as the early yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, rough to the touch, and often have a fuzzy texture. Hieracium praepallens is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
